text: So im running into an issue where a client has a template they purchased and its one blog template is using alot of custom HubL statements to make things work. Problem is I cant get to the source of those template pieces because there is no custom hubl module in DMv2 so I can't edit it
If you click on the hubl module I think you can still see the code if you scroll down on the right sidebar.
If it’s a newer site this wont work because the button isn’t available. but you should be able to use the revert button. make your changes to the hubl module and flip back to DM2 when you’re done
If it is a newer site which doesn’t have that button I’d contact support. see if at the very least they can enable that button for you.
but will reverting the DMv2 back to DMv1 and then back again cause any potential issues?
If there was a way to simply "view module source" I could just copy/paste to a new CM and then replace it
I do it all the time, it’s mostly safe. The real issue comes with having  a site’s modules be mixed DMv2 and DM1 occasionally that causes issues on pages

agree, I did that a few times too without issues.
But I think if you want, you should be able to see the source code of the template and grab the code you want there to convert that to a new CM
true, its just the tempalte used alot of those modules so trying to make sense where on starts and one ends is a little blurry
sure, add some html comments or classes to find them easily
thats a good point lol, totally forgot about the wrapping html for a min there
